text.0: Type 2 diabetes is the leading cause of chronic kidney disease worldwide. Recommended management of CKD involves control of hypertension and hyperglycemia, use of an ACE inhibitor or an ARB, and an SGLT2 inhibitor. Research shows despite treatment, CKD progression risks remain. https://t.co/ly6RdmUQQs
text.1: A 22-year-old man presented with pain, redness, and decreased vision after a bee sting in the left eye. Ocular examination showed diffuse corneal haziness with a retained stinger.

text.3: The NEJM Clinical Cases Resource Center aggregates interactive cases and educational resources developed specifically for teaching, continuous learning, and professional development.
text.4: Shiriki Kumanyika discusses U.S. and global strategies for addressing obesity and related health threats.
